titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I worked rather fruitlessly at the Article. I attended Mattins and Evensong. I wrote to Ernest. I walked with Olive after tea, and had a very pleasant talk. We grow closer pals every day. There came to dinner Major Vane–Tempest; and Hughes. So we had some more singing, and so to bed.
